home resources

Resources

Software

These programmes range from quite useful to absolutely essential, with a focus on open source or freely accessible software.
  • LaTeX is the software system for document creation and academic publications. To use the software, you need three things.
    1. A TeX distribution, such as MiKTeX.
    2. Some TeX editor software, such as TeXmaker.
    3. A PDF reader, such as Adobe Acrobat.

LaTeX

  • CodeCogs. This handy website compiles LaTeX code in real time.
  • Detexify finds LaTeX commands for symbols by drawing.
  • LaTeX wikibook. This is a fairly comprehensive wiki about LaTeX, useful when you have learnt the basics and want more specific guidance.
  • CTAN. Here you can find documentation about all LaTeX packages to find out how they work.
  • Mathpix. This snipping tool allows you to take screen capture of some mathematics and automatically generate LaTeX code which replicates it.
  • Overleaf. This web-based LaTeX platform allows you to create and compile LaTeX documents without any additional software.
